storyInfo: On this day, on the clock, Kjera gets sucked into a dispute. The stuff of the argument is nothing new, but the whole thing brings someone to mind for her.

attributes.content: Hey! Been to the printing house now they've refurbished it?
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: No, I haven't. What about it?
attributes.name: Curious Staffer

attributes.content: I went with someone to see yesterday, and it blew my mind.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Everything in there's brand-new, and the sheer amount of space! Nothing like the crappy little place it used to be.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Look, their manager gave me a sample. Look at their print quality now.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Oh, wow, this paper... and the type is so detailed... How did they get this good?!
attributes.name: Curious Staffer

attributes.content: Right? It pumps me up just knowing whatever we write, they're turning into books!
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Really? What a blessing—think how out of date their place used to be. Almost unusable.
attributes.name: Curious Staffer

attributes.content: You're telling me! And the manager's thrilled too. Says they'll chew right through it no matter how much we ask to print.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Hahaha, we'd better not fall behind then! We don't want to waste printing this good with bad writing.
attributes.name: Curious Staffer

attributes.content: I'm here! Sorry, the kitchen was a little short-handed this morning.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Gosh, hi there, Kjarr.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: You should hear yourself, though. Aren't head maids busy enough? You shouldn't have to go to all this trouble for us, we'll be fine.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Oh, but I should. I went and asked the Saintess for this job—I'd be furious at myself if I was sloppy.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Plus, she has a lot of interest in the Kjerag Guidebook. It's part of how the outside sees our lovely place, you know.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: We were saying! Ooh, doesn't it just feel like Kjerag gets a little better every day these days? Our crew can't be falling behind now.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Is there another Tri-Clan Council meeting today?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: They can't help it. Victoria's position is a major hassle.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: My. So we're finally reaping what Enciodes sowed over there.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: At this point, it's all we can do to think on our feet.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Oh, Kjarr.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: There's something I want us to discuss.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I'd like to make an appointment with Her—
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Kjarr? Kjarr? Hello, are you in there?
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Hm? Oh, I'm fine. Come to mention, where's our dear old Chief of Tourism? He hates even the mention of falling behind.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Huh, true. Kaj's barely ever late.
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Is this the Department for Tourism?
attributes.name: Fretful Wife

attributes.content: Who might you be?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Oh, aren't you Kaj's wife?
attributes.name: Lively Staffer

attributes.content: Yes, yes! Oh, wonderful, I found the right place.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: What's the matter? You look pale.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Could you let me meet the Saintess? It's urgent business.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You're Head Maid Kjarr, aren't you, the one always by her side?
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Oh, thank Kjeragandr! It's about my spouse, you see.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: He's always hated the idea of my son studying abroad, but my son doesn't like to back down either. He's been pulling the tuition fee together all on his own, without my spouse knowing, so he can go still.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: I... *sigh* I'm soft at heart. He asked me to hide it from Kaj, and so I did.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Kjeragandr knows how, but Kaj found out anyway. He's off to the station now to catch the boy.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: He's a temperamental one, he is, but my boy's no less. If they let this become a full-on fight, I—honestly, I don't know what I'll even do with myself.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Kjarr, could you please ask the Saintess to help us?
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: She isn't staying atop Mount Karlan today. I'm afraid it'd be too late to find her there, even if I do go.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Wh—Well, now what?!
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Oh, it's all my fault! If I could've just stopped Kaj for a second...
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Here. I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: One of my duties is standing in to split the Saintess's load, you know.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: In cases like this, I can deliver some words in the Saintess's name.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Right, right, right, of course. All us townsfolk know how close you and her are, Madam Head Maid. I'm sure whatever you say would reach them.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: We'll want to hurry, then. I'd have to guess Kaj's already at the station by now.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Mm. Let's go.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Oh, by Kjeragandr, how do we find Kaj in a station this busy—
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: I'VE TOLD YOU AND I'VE TOLD YOU AGAIN! You'll have NO thoughts of foreign schooling as long as I live and breathe!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: I think he's saved us the search.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Heavens, there's a crowd already! He'll be the laughing stock of the neighbors.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: And I'll keep saying it back, I'm going to this school, and that's final.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: Genuinely, it's beyond me where you got this malarkey about being 'advanced' into your head.
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: It would be beyond you. All you care about is your faith—oops, no, I mean, how to work your so-called 'faith' to your own benefit.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: YOU SHUT YOUR MOUTH!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: You sneak off to the station without telling your own father, and now the nerve to talk to me like this! Aren't you embarrassed enough?!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: What, me? You're the embarrassing one here, Chief Kaj of Tourism!
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: You horrid little—!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: Please, Kjarr! Anything, quick!
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: (*sigh* The mettle in Enya to handle these issues every single day. Let me leave... Let me go back to she who swore to split the Saintess's load, because I have a nice round slap to give her.)
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: (I may as well say something or other. Enya can take the rest after that.)
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kjarr?
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: *sigh* Very well—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: So what? If you can't get what you want from Grandpa, you'll settle for making me in your image instead?
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: YOU SAY THAT ONE MORE TIME!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: Do you know where Grandpa is right now?
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: No, no you don't.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: You've never understood him.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: I don't understand him? HE doesn't understand ME!
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: Hmph, keep telling yourself that. I'm not giving my whole life to the mountain weeds and rubble he way he did, but I actually LIKE Grandpa.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: I'll go and I'll learn all that advanced stuff, then I'll come back and help him, and once I do, he can polish Kjeragandr's claws that much faster and easier.
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: I'm not like you, stepping on everything he's left behind, everything everyone before him left behind, just so you can climb on up!
attributes.name: Youth

attributes.content: YOU—
attributes.name: Chief Kaj

attributes.content: Sorry, can I just check who Kaj's father—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: His pappsen? Odd man, spends all year up in the mountains hammering away, rarely even comes home.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: They were already on awful terms when I married Kaj. I'd like to get along with him, but I've never found the chance.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: One time while drunk, Kaj said that apparently, my in-law's under the impression he's doing Kjeragandr's fingernails, and that's why he stays up in the mountains all the time.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: ...So what does Kaj think?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: He... He says he'll never follow his pappsen's example as long as he lives.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Calls him a moron, says he hasn't the first about faith.
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: Well, then.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kjarr, where are you going? Didn't you say you'd step in and help?!
attributes.name: Chief's Wife

attributes.content: I have someone better for the job.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: (Mutter) ...At least, maybe.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: By one means or another, as they grow, most people of Kjerag come to know the names of the mountains that surround this place we call Kjerag.
For one reason or another, they'll set foot into those mountains for themselves, but always the more well-known ones.
The ones no one talks of... those are seldom intruded, even by locals of the land.
Yet the mountain Kjarr scales now is one of the unnoted—a peak so obscure it was never even named, a height you wouldn't assume anyone dwelt on.
And if anyone else is on this mountain path at this moment, she might frankly be a little surprised.
For a very simple reason. Aside from the peaks Karlan Trade promotes for sightseeing, no mountain's paths could claim to be as smooth as this one's.
—No, even the most tourist-magnet peaks struggle to have paths this pristine.
Yes. Pristine.
The trees are trimmed, the grass seems to grow in its designated place, and there are no loose rocks to be found.
It's practically a garden.
Halfway up, a crisp clanking drifts down from on high. It's fast one moment, slow the next, reverberating through the valley, as if a giant sits in the pass hammering his weapon out.
Kjarr remembers this sound.
When she reaches the summit, so too is the sound's source revealed.
He is no giant, and what he beats is no weapon at all.
He's but a lone, wizened hunchback, chipping a hammer and chisel away at a prominent jut of stone.
The old man, his hammer and chisel, everything comes off dwarfed compared to that stone. Not that he seems to mind. He simply carries on hammering, chiseling.
Phew...
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: For some reason, Kjarr lets out what feels like a sigh of relief.
And thereafter, she takes a set of spare tools from the side, draws next to the old man, and together with him, begins to chip away at the looming stone.
He asks nothing, and Kjarr says nothing.
The silence is no awkward one, but instead brings on a kind of mutual understanding, one that defies words.
Chisel, then hammer. Chisel, then hammer.
*huff*—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: He remains silent, and simply shuffles to the side, where from his rucksack he pulls a swig of water.
After that, he takes out two lovingly parchment-wrapped grain cakes, and hands one of them over to Kjarr.
Kjarr hardly refuses. Taking it, she sits down beside him and digs in.
The old man unwraps the other cake, meanwhile, and begins to devour it in great bites.
What is it you're doing here?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: What are you here for, if you don't know?
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: It looked like fun.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: For generations, our family has done but one thing, and that is trim Kjeragandr's Claws for Her.
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: Claws...? You mean, the fingernails?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: He lifts his head, and jabs a finger at those faraway peaks, the loftiest and most endless of them all. Then he points to their neighbors, a run of peaks that seem quite modest in comparison.
Those ranging mountains are Her Back. All those little peaks that bulge up alongside them, those are Her 'Claws'.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Well, isn't Kjeragandr a woman? They're erecting a statue of her on the lake island right now.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: That is the human form She takes to reach out to Her people. That, yes, is Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: But these mountains, too, these are Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: My ancestor witnessed it. The scene. There in the black rains was She, and cast forth divine might, and rose a shield to protect the people of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: And in the end, She was victorious, but paid a hefty price.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Grateful for Her protection, my ancestor sought to tend to Her Claws.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: And so, that became your family tradition.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: If word of any of this got out, I worry the entire Vine-Bead Court would trip head over heels to meet you.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I assume you came in my son's place, girl.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Go and tell him. I will not give him what my forebears left behind.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: I'm not your son's messenger.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I just feel it's a shame. It seems like neither your son nor your grandson plan to take up your mantle.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: ...Hammering away in the mountains is all I've known, all my life.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: I did assume Kaj would follow after me, just as I did after my pappa, but—before I even realized it, he became this way.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: I'm bad at words, and I had no idea what to do, so into the mountains I went to hide.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, Kaj turns forty this year.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: His childhood was right when the last Silverash head, Olafur, came back from study abroad...
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Mmm. You probably remember. That's when they started building these railroad whatever-you-call-its.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: But you probably didn't know that Olafur brought back more than technologies. He brought ideologies.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: His free-thinking brought Kjerag into total dispute around then. And I've no doubts that out of them all, it was the young who were most easily impacted.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I think... it must have struck Kaj deeply.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: But his family was generationally bound to tend to Kjeragandr's nails.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I can only imagine he found himself quite trapped.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I can't know what thoughts he had after that, or what actions he took—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: But perhaps, by thinking along those lines, you can figure out what made him the way he is now.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Damn me.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: No. It's not your fault.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You took on your hammer and chisel from your father, and your father took them on from his father, all the way back to your ancestor—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You've all been devoutly, wholeheartedly doing what you had to do. What mistake was it that you ever made?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You see—
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Your grandson says he plans to go and learn a few new things, all so you can better polish Kjeragandr's claws.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: ...Noah, the boy, always visits me.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: But the things, that he gets for me, those communicating terminal sorts of machines, I don't understand them one bit.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Do you truly hate these new things?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I watch as they lay the railroad bit by bit from east to west, and I watch as they build their tall buildings bit by bit ever taller.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: If it was true that Kjeragandr didn't like it, She would have but to roll over to shake it all off.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: I... trust Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Well, keep trusting in her, then.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: There's one thing I can promise you.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: If Kjeragandr does roll over and get up from the mountains one day, then those fingernails you've tended to will be the part of Her that glitters most.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Watching Kjarr depart, her back turned, the old man is hit with a sudden sense of familiarity.
For an age, he sifts through his mind. And finally, he realizes. Her appearance is akin, in ways, to that of the figure passed down by his ancestor in tradition.

The one who walked and saw a land of deep disaster, who walked and saw despair twined with grief, who walked and saw branches bud in the thawing frost, who walked and saw the warming sun. The one who brought hope to Kjerag.
A streak of bewilderment flashes through the old man's clouded eyes.
By Kjeragandr, by Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: He pulls the comms terminal from his grandson out of his pocket.
Though he can't get used to it, he's made an effort to learn, in order to make his grandson happy.
In the terminal are saved two numbers. One is home. One is his grandson's. He calls the latter.
Noah. Yes, it's me.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Kaj is there, isn't he?
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Tell him for me, I'll give him what he wants.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: But, he must let you go.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Yes, that's alright.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: Good. Now, give the terminal to him.
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: I have to talk to him—
attributes.name: Nail-Tender

attributes.content: After just a few steps, without knowing why, Kjarr comes to a standstill.
She lifts her head and looks to the mountain range afar. At some point, a strange stone has floated to her side.
My, my, silly you.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Could you imagine saying any of that back in those times?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kaj's faith, devout yet blind. Noah's drive, zestful yet reckless.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: And Dag, that type of human you once appreciated—
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: How many nights you laid in the mountains' cradle, lulled to sleep by the sound of clinks and clanks.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Silly you. You forgot how to be grateful, and talked Dag's ear off to boot. Now you've done it. Who could like you after this?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kjarr cups the stone in her hands, her tone as if resentful at the person behind it, yet in some way as if looking in a mirror.
The stone subtly trembles, then begins to sound.
It is her voice.
My, my, silly you.
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: You still won't admit just how much you've changed, ever since getting to know the girl?
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: You have friends, now. A berth, now. Wants, now. As naturally as natural comes, you have a standpoint now.
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: Isn't that the one thing you used to hate most?
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: Didn't you always hope the Kjerags would go on to live with minds of their own?
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: Wasn't keeping watch over them all you wanted to do?
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: Silly you, and this family of Silverashes too, for tormenting you so!
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: Babbling about hope, blathering about future, making a sorry fool out of you!
attributes.name: Hovering Stone

attributes.content: The plateau's hoary winds sweep through the ranges, and on with a brush past her lobes. To her ears, it is the sound of Her laughing.
A touch teasing, a touch mocking, a touch self-defeated, a touch helpless.
Who is She laughing at? None but Herself, of course.
If you want to bring up friends, you're guilty of making some yourself back then.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: If you want to bring up relationships, you've never once been able to stop yourself getting involved.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You want to help, yet you tell me I shouldn't lay a finger.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: You feel they're wrong, yet you think they should arrive at their own judgments.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Silly you. Can you honestly not tell why she was the one?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Is she so special she'd stand alone for an eon before and after?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Or just, plain and simple, she's done for you what you always wanted?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kjarr, where are you?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: I'm... You'd have no idea even if I told you.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I'll take that. I hear you showed yourself and solved a little issue for me?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Oh, my. Word does get around to you fast, Saintess.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: I don't care to hear, but they keep insisting I do anyway.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Tell me what's on your mind, Saintess.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: How are you feeling about my question from before?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: What question? Your dinner tonight?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Kjarr, I'm not asking as a joke!
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: The appointment?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Victoria's about to send their people here.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Once they arrive, I want Her not to get involved, no matter what happens.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: It's not the time for Her to act yet, is it?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: If we can't even make it through this little crisis ourselves, well, I'll just go and dive into Lake Silberneherze.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Good grief. You really put your brother's stubbornness to shame at times, you know.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: And thank you very much for saying that.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Will you be back at the Vine-Bead Court tonight?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: I'm on my way back now. I have your dinner to make, Saintess—I can't be dilly-dallying.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Just a hunch, but are you in a good mood?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Is it that obvious to you?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: After how long we've known each other? Of course.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: It's nothing much, just saw nice weather today and went for a little walk.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Good evening.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Mm-hm. Good evening.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Pfft. My, my, silly me.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: A laugh like bells takes to the wind, and on with brush after brush past the mountaintops. This time, it's her laughing.
She lingers no longer, and sets off for Mount Karlan.
It's time she got home—there's work waiting for her.
